articles.description: Cricketer-turned-TV host Andrew "Freddie" Flintoff opens up about his car crash for the first time.
articles.title: Andrew Flintoff 'thought he had died' in Top Gear crash

articles.description: Just a few years ago, Chris Brookes-Smith could have died from eating peanuts - but taking part in a clinical trial has changed his life.
articles.title: 'My peanut allergy nearly killed me - now I eat them every day'

articles.description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and special envoy Steve Witkoff are no longer attending the talks.
articles.title: Russia-Ukraine war: London ceasefire talks downgraded

articles.description: Sophie Lloyd disguised herself as a man to join the Magic Circle in 1991, when female magicians were not allowed membership.
articles.title: Magician who pretended to be a man given Magic Circle membership

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Boeing's boss says it's looking to sell 50 more planes China has on order to other countries.
articles.title: China sends Boeing planes back to US over Trump tariffs

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Experts say the discovery provides the first physical evidence of gladiatorial combat with animals.
articles.title: Bites on gladiator bones first evidence of combat with lion

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Rhianon Bragg, who was stalked by her ex-partner, felt "trapped" when he was released from prison.
articles.title: Killers and stalkers should live in restricted zones, say victims

articles.description: From rare earths to billions in US debt, here's what China has in its arsenal - and how strong they are.

articles.description: UK negotiators are working "flat out" to get a trade deal with the US, Chancellor Rachel Reeves says.
articles.title: Rachel Reeves signals UK could lower US car tariffs in push for trade deal

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The body of the pontiff, who died on Monday, has been moved into the church for a period of public mourning.
articles.title: Mourners visit Pope Francis lying in state at St Peter's Basilica
